trends: There have been 6 other sightings in Shelton
There was one other sighting in Shelton on or around July 14th 2008
divs: sighting detailsi just sent in a report yesterday regarding these flashes in the sky i, and sometimes witnesses, have been seeing in the night sky (and once in a bright sunset sky). it happened again last night and now i feel simply frustrated wondering what it is. again, i emphasize: i know aircraft flight patterns and behaviors locally. i grew up in the approach path to seatac airport, my husband flies fixed wing and helicopter, i also grew up in a family where my father was a teacher and one of our regular summer activities was sleeping under the stars and watching satellites. dad would write the satellite sightings down on a pad and call some number in seattle the next morning and then report to us what satellites they were and what country they originated in. we even saw a blinking satellite on several occasions and learned about satellites with mylar on them rolling and "appearing" to be blinking as they rolled in orbit. these "flashes" i have been seeing are different in that: the flashes are brighter and whiter than strobes or aircraft lights (except in the case an aircraft is banking or turning in the sky and you get a strong flash when it is directly at you...but you see the aircraft and its trajectory). the flashes are erratic when multiple are viewed. you'll see i.e., one bright flash...3 to 5 seconds of nothing...then another flash...1\5 second, another...then nothing no matter how long you fix your eyes on the spot scanning peripherally for any flight movement. the flashes have a slow "blink" time. like someone opening for instance, a lens a shutter and closing it. i saw the multiple flashes sunday night 7\13 under the handle of the big dipper around 10:30pm or so...i didn't look at the exact time. it was same spot i and my daughter viewed the flashes in early may. last night, 7\14, i saw a bright flash straight over head and the nw slightly. just one bright white flash and although i stared at the spot to pick up any aircraft and as with the others, there was simply nothing after the flashes. just dark sky. i need to point out that i hate sensationalizing and stories that obviously are embellished for excitement. i need to also point out i have seen many flashes over my lifetime and when they are an aircraft, you eventually see their flight pattern take up at some point and see navigation lights. these are just so different. brighter, longer flash time, and no movement accompanying the flashes. i was pretty excited last night to see the flashes two nights in a row. i'm telling you begin to think it's "personal". i'm really trying not to go there, but it was like it was flashing at me. i feel stupid for even suggesting that but i figure you hear it all. i'm not quick to jump to conclusions regarding ufos probably because of growing up with aircraft and satellites. i'm even wondering if there is some metal debris out in space that floats around our atmosphere and periodically rolls so it reflects the sun back really bright. i just don't know if you'd simply see one to three sporadic flashes and then nothing.
